PRIMARY: Roger Hallam (Extinction Rebellion co-founder), Larch Maxey, and Michael Lynch-White plotted to close Heathrow Airport by flying drones near it in September 2019 under the banner "Heathrow Pause." Their demand was to force the Government to abandon plans for a third runway at Heathrow. The protest failed to attract hundreds as planned and caused no actual flight disruptions, though policing costs exceeded Â£1 million. All three received suspended prison sentences.

SECONDARY: None mentioned.

OTHER FOCAL: The court proceedings, sentencing details, and defendants' arguments about protecting democratic rights to protest and raising climate emergency awareness.

TONE: The article maintains a neutral, factual tone focused on legal proceedings rather than taking a stance on the protest itself.
